revised_title: Life History Evolution in Heterogeneous Environments: A Review of Theory
tldr: This article reviews the theory of life history evolution in heterogeneous environments, focusing on the implications of trade-offs and the effects of spatial and temporal variation. It discusses the importance of understanding fitness measures and the role of phenotypic plasticity in adapting to different habitats. The article also highlights the limitations of existing models and suggests possible resolutions for further analysis.
